og_description:
We’re looking for a talented Swift UI Engineer to help build out the Hypercontext MacOS and iOS apps. As an important member of the Engineering team, you will build features that will integrate and scale our platform, mentor developers on your future team, and act as a cross-functional leader for our go to market teams. 


Hypercontext is a YC backed, remote first, emoji-loving startup that believes that good communication between a manager and employee is the most important factor in the success and motivation of a team.


If you thrive in a team environment, hold yourself to high standards, and want to make a serious impact in improving the workplace, then Hypercontext is the place for you.

#### At Hypercontext, you will: 
- Brainstorm with Co-founders, product leaders and development teams to conceptualize new features for the MacOS and iOS apps
- Collaborate with platform engineers to build out APIs 
- Implement custom native user interfaces using the latest Swift UI programming techniques
- Troubleshoot customer issues as they relate to the MacOS and iOS apps
- Ship, manage, and launch apps via fastlane and the Apple App Store
- Mentor other engineers and collaborate on code reviews


#### Key Qualifications:
- Bachelorʼs Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
- Proficiency with Swift
- Ability to work collaboratively and explain complex ideas clearly
- Thoughtfulness and empathy in designing APIs
- Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and organizational skills


#### Additional Requirements: 
Experience with any of the following is a plus, but not required:
- Background in macOS app development or design
- Familiarity with AppKit, UIKit, or other Cocoa frameworks
- Expertise in Swift and the Swift Standard Library or SwiftUI APIs
- Ability to understand and debug code written by peers
- Experience designing clean and maintainable APIs
- Experience writing unit tests and testable code
- Experience in a small rapid growth startup environment
- Technical writing experience
- Experience or interest in educating others


#### Why work with us? What makes Hypercontext extra special: 
- Build something important with a fun, dynamic and collaborative team
- Competitive compensation
- Employee stock options
- Paid vacation that starts right away
- Epic benefits
- Remote work
- Supportive parental leave policy
- Career development and learning opportunities


Apply with a resume, github account name, and links to your work online
og_title: Software Engineer, Swift UI / MacOS at Hypercontext | Y Combinator
title: Hypercontext (YC S21) is hiring a SwiftUI developer

og_description:
The AlphaFold computer program predicted protein structures for the whole
human genome, which has been considered as a remarkable breakthrough both in
artificial intelligence (AI) application and structural biology. Despite the
varying confidence level, these predicted structures still could significantly
contribute to the structure-based drug design of novel targets, especially the
ones with no or limited structural information. In this work, we successfully
applied AlphaFold in our end-to-end AI-powered drug discovery engines
constituted of a biocomputational platform PandaOmics and a generative
chemistry platform Chemistry42, to identify a first-in-class hit molecule of a
novel target without an experimental structure starting from target selection
towards hit identification in a cost- and time-efficient manner. PandaOmics
provided the targets of interest and Chemistry42 generated the molecules based
on the AlphaFold predicted structure, and the selected molecules were
synthesized and tested in biological assays. Through this approach, we
identified a small molecule hit compound for CDK20 with a Kd value of 8.9 +/-
1.6 uM (n = 4) within 30 days from target selection and after only synthesizing
7 compounds. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first reported small
molecule targeting CDK20 and more importantly, this work is the first
demonstration of AlphaFold application in the hit identification process in
early drug discovery.
og_title: AlphaFold Accelerates Artificial Intelligence Powered Drug Discovery: Efficient Discovery of a Novel Cyclin-dependent Kinase 20 (CDK20) Small Molecule Inhibitor
title: AlphaFold-Powered Drug Discovery of a Novel CDK20 Inhibitor

og_description:
Keyboards and Open-Source, how is that related? In my Keyboard Fun post from last year I talked a bit about my interest in mechanical keyboards.
Since then, I played around with a few more keyboards/switches/keycaps/…
Interesting enough, beside the actual hardware, naturally there is some software component to all these keyboards, too.
Whereas most commercial keyboards still come with proprietary firmware, there is the trend within the keyboard enthusiast scene to go for open-source firmware.
og_title: Keyboards and Open-Source
title: Keyboards and Open-Source
